plugins.name: Font changer
plugins.description:
Font Changer is a powerful plugin that enhances the efficiency of your design work. It allows you to easily identify and quickly change fonts used on the current page. With search and bookmark features, managing frequently used fonts becomes effortless.

Automatically adjusts font thickness to maintain consistency and enable diverse visual expressions. Simplify font management and streamline your design process with Font Changer.


Currently in beta. Feel free to use and feedback is always welcome.


designbasekorea@gmail.com

plugins.name: Spacers
plugins.description:
Smarter Autolayouts with Spacers


> Add custom spaces between component

> Hide and show spacers in one clic

> Create new autolayouts in seconds

> Custom sizes

> Custom colors


A plugin by the UX 82 Team > Elsa, Arnaud, Bertrand, Christophe, Guillaume, Olivier


> Add custom spaces between component


Select the component where to add a spacer.

Choose your direction

Choose your spacer size

And the spacer is added to your design


> Hide and show spacers in one clic


Just switch to see spacers or not

The state is saved in the document so you can share it clean. Anyone with the plugin can show them back.


> Create new autolayouts in seconds


If you add a spacer in a direction that does not fit with the parent autolayout, Spacers plugin smartly adds you a new autolayout.


It also works with multi selection in a same frame : select at least the first and last element you need to move with a spacer and a inner autolayout will be created.

plugins.name: Supa Snapshot
plugins.description:
Introducing Supa Snapshot: 

the ultimate tool for creating stunning snapshots instantly within Figma. Simply select one or more layers, and watch as the plugin quickly generates a high-quality snapshot.


One of the key features of this plugin is its ability to create reusable snapshots. Once you've made the perfect snapshot, you can save it and use it again and again in other designs. Sharing snapshots with others is also a breeze - simply export them as images or share them on social media.


The Figma Snapshot Plugin is designed to be user-friendly, with an intuitive interface that allows you to easily adjust and tweak your snapshots to perfection. 


Whether you're a seasoned designer or just starting out, this plugin will help you create stunning visuals in no time.

plugins.name: Count Layers
plugins.description:
This is a small plugin that counts layers in a selection and specifies how many of them are selected directly (so-called top-level elements) or entirely hidden.


This information can be useful in the process of optimising the file and creating scalable and performant design system.


Another potentially useful feature of this plugin is that it logs to the console how many layers of different kinds are presented in the selection. In practice, it looks something like this (see the types property):


{
    "total": 298,
    "hidden": 32,
    "topLevel": 47,
    "types": {
        "RECTANGLE": 71,
        "COMPONENT": 2,
        "TEXT": 50,
        "INSTANCE": 24,
        "GROUP": 21,
        "FRAME": 73,
        "VECTOR": 51,
        "ELLIPSE": 6
    }
}


This information is rarely needed but can be useful in some cases.

plugins.name: Figma Format
plugins.description:
Figma Format let's you format your canvas by grouping them by the 
 names.

‚ñ† How it works
It will check the names of each layer and group them by the text before the separator (by default "/") and layout nicely by their groups.

‚ñ† Customization
You can customize how you want to format your cavas.
- Spacing for X and Y axis
- Grouping seprator (by default "/")
- Vertical or Horizontal Layout

‚ñ† Example
If we have 5 frames named the following
- "Article/List"
- "Article/List"
- "Account/My Page"
- "Account/Settings"
- "Account/Settings". 

And formats using this plugin, it will be layouted like this:

| Account/My Page | Account/Settings | Account/SettingsB |
| Article/Detail | Article/List |

‚ñ† Feedback
If you have any feedback feel free to open an issue!
https://github.com/kawamurakazushi/figma-format/issues

‚ñ† Project Roadmap
[x] Sort the Layers
[ ] Customization Options
  [x]  Spacing for x-axis and y-axis
  [x]  Separator (default is"/")
  [x]  Number of element in a row / column.
  [x]  Horizontal / Vertical 
  [ ]  Postion of the seprator, for grouping (default is 1)

‚ñ† Support
Like on Figma, or Star on Github is always a motivation :D

https://github.com/kawamurakazushi/figma-format

plugins.name: typographyssimo-converter
plugins.description:
Generate text styles via typographyssimo.jamillazarev.com


Usage

  • Generate text styles using https://typographyssimo.jamillazarev.com/
  • Click "For Figma" in the upper right corner
  • Run the plugin, Paste & press "Generate styles"


Keep in mind

  • A short link, properties & CSS will be attached to style in the description.
  • The plugin knows what you have already generated ‚Äì you don't need to reconnect the styles if you don't change names. Just paste the new URL into the plugin.

plugins.name: Check Character Limit
plugins.description:
Set and enforce character limits on text layers with Check Character Limit.


Usage

  1. Add [CharLimit: XX] to the name of your text layers. XX is the maximum character count for the layer. For example: Description Text [CharLimit: 2000].
  2. When you ready to check character limits, select the layers you'd like to check and run the plugin. If no layers are selected before running, the plugin will check the entire page (see note below).
  3. Text layers that exceed their limits will be flagged in red. Check the top of your layer list to locate the flags.
  4. Select a flag from the layer list and press Shift + 2 to locate it visually.
  5. Edit the text layer to fit your character limit.


Note

If nothing is selected while running the plugin it will check all the text layers on the page. To check a specific layer or all layers inside a frame, select the layers or frame and run the plugin.


Open Source

This plugin is open source and can be found here.
plugins.tagline: Set and enforce character limits on text layers

plugins.name: Loops Feedback

Build an interactive survey on top of your designs and ask multiple choice, open and closed questions.


Gather comments from customers, team members, and stakeholders and transform it into actionable insight with AI.


Research that often takes weeks, can be done in hours with Loops üí™


HOW LOOPS WORKS


  1. Build an interactive survey on top of your design and asking multiple choice questions or open text fields about your design.
  2. Choose your audience. Use your own teammates or users. Need external feedback from a certain demographic? No problem - recruit from our global panel of 110m consumers.
  3. Users give annotated feedback on your design. Get quantitative and qualitative results in realtime.


WHY LOOPS


Remove the admin of audience feedback.

Access 110m people from all major countries instantly.


Keep feedback focused.

Your respondents are guided step-by-step through your designs.


Connect insight to ideas. See precise feedback annotated on your work.


Visit useloops.com

plugins.name: Sheets to Variables
plugins.description:
Unleash the power of collaboration between your design and content teams with Sheets to Variables! Now supporting both Google Sheets and CSV, this Figma plugin transforms your spreadsheet data into Figma variables, making your designs dynamic and easy to update.


üöÄ Features:


  1. Import Variables from Google Sheets & CSV: Got a spreadsheet full of design variables? Simply paste the Google Sheets URL or upload a CSV file, and watch as your design variables come to life in Figma.
  2. Multiple Variable Modes: Need to have different modes for variables? We got you covered. Just add additional columns and name the rename the sheet header to create new modes.
  3. Multiple Variable Types: Create STRING, FLOAT (number), BOOLEAN and COLOR type variables straight from your Google Sheet.
  4. Variable Descriptions: Add descriptions to your variables directly from Google Sheet. Just add $Description column in the sheet.
  5. Support for Code Syntax: Add code Syntax for iOS, Android and Web directly from the Google Sheet. Just add $iOS, $Android and $Web columns in the sheet and start adding your code syntax for the variables.
  6. Easy to Use: We believe in simplicity. Simply provide the Google Sheet URL and the collection name, and you're good to go.
  7. Overwrite Existing Variables: If a variable already exists, don't worry! Our plugin will simply update the existing variable with the new value from the Google Sheet.
  8. One-Click Template Access: Not sure how to structure your Google Sheet? Access to our pre-made template with a click of a button.
  9. Ignore Columns from importing: Have some columns that you don't want to import? Exclude columns by adding a $ before the column header (e.g., rename internal to $internal).


üëÄ How it works:


  1. Prepare your Google Sheet or CSV file with columns - one for the variable name, one for type and the others for values for different modes. We recommend using the template to get started.
  2. Open the Sheets to Variables plugin in Figma.
  3. Enter your Google Sheets URL or upload a CSV file, then specify the collection name.
  4. Hit Import and watch as your spreadsheet transforms into design variables in Figma.


üí° Useful Tips:


  1. Name and Type are reserved by the plugin to identify the name and type of variable
  2. Type column should have only one for the following Values - STRING, FLOAT (for numbers), BOOLEAN and COLOR.
  3. $Description is reserved by the plugin to add description to the variables.
  4. $iOS, $Android and $Web are reserved by the plugin to add code syntax to the variables.
  5. If there are any columns in your Google Sheet that you'd like the plugin to ignore, just add $ symbol to the beginning of the column name. E.g. If the column header is internal, rename it to $internal and the plugin will not import it.

accepted.name: Shreyansh Kotak
accepted.description: As a Product Designer, I'm passionate about enhancing user experiences. Focused on UX design, design systems, and no-code tools.

plugins.name: Text Selector
plugins.description:
Text Classifier is a convenient tool designed for selecting text layers in a design project based on specific criteria. It offers users the ability to choose between text, numbers, and special characters, with an additional option to include punctuations as special characters.


How it works


Simply select all the layers you want it to analyze and click on the criteria and Text Classifier will select text layers that contain either text, numbers or special characters. If no layers are selected, the plugin will select all the layers on the page that match the criteria.


This plugin will only work if the layers are Text Layers. Text that are in vector shapes or images will not be detected.
plugins.tagline: Select text layers based on their contents

plugins.name: Text Crop
plugins.description:
Text Crop is a plugin that removes the whitespace around text boxes. No longer will you have extra leading above and below your text. Layout designs in the way you intended.


This plugin creates a component, which dynamically resizes to ensure text is the right size. You can use any styles you want in the component, just hit 'Crop'.


Fully responsive, the text crop component works inside any auto layout frames, and even works inside nested components!


Feel free to use this in your design system as a component, it even works across libraries


Instructions

An in-depth guide has been kindly written by the James Newson from the NewsKit Design Team.


  1. Create the Text Crop components by running the command 'Create Components'
  2. Make an instance of the crop component. Change any of the text properties, the plugin will handle them.
  3. For paragraphs use the variant "multi-line" switch
  4. Open the Instance cropping panel. 'Crop Instances'
  5. Set your cropping preferences, and click "Crop"


Text Crop can crop multiple selections, and crop entire pages of Text Crop instances using the relaunch buttons in the side panel.
plugins.tagline: Trim the whitespace off text - layout typography relative to the baseline and capheight

plugins.name: Unsplash Banners, Avatars, Illustrations
plugins.description:
A powerful and user-friendly plugin that brings the entire Unsplash image library directly into your Figma workspace. Find and insert high-quality, royalty-free images with just a few clicks.

Key Features

1. Quick Search Categories

Instantly find the perfect image with our pre-defined categories:

Avatars - Perfect for user profiles, testimonials, and comments

Hero Images - Ideal for landing pages, headers, and banners

Illustrations - Great for onboarding, empty states, and 404 pages

Product Photos - Essential for e-commerce and product listings

Team Photos - Perfect for about pages and company introductions

Device Mockups - Showcase your designs in realistic device frames

2. Smart Search

Default search for avatars when you open the plugin

Custom search input for specific queries

Easy-to-use radio button filters

Pagination for browsing through results

3. Image Management

Grid view of search results

Detailed view for each image

Download images directly

One-click insertion into Figma

View image details including dimensions and photographer credits

4. User-Friendly Interface

Modern dark theme design

Responsive grid layout

Loading indicators

Smooth transitions

Easy navigation

How to Use

Install the Plugin

Search for "Unsplash Image Search" in Figma's plugin menu

Click "Install"

Search for Images

Use the quick category buttons for common image types

Or type your search query in the search box

Click the search button or press Enter

Insert Images

Click on any image to view details

Click "Insert into Figma" to add to your design

Or click "Download" to save the image

Navigate Results

Use the pagination controls at the bottom

Click page numbers to jump to specific pages

Use previous/next buttons for sequential navigation

Tips

Start with the category buttons for quick access to common image types

Use specific search terms for more precise results

Check image dimensions before inserting

Use the refresh button to get new random images

Images are automatically tracked for proper attribution

Support

If you enjoy using this plugin, consider supporting its development by clicking the "Buy me coffee" button in the interface.

Avatars - Perfect for user profiles, testimonials, and comments

Hero Images - Ideal for landing pages, headers, and banners

Illustrations - Great for onboarding, empty states, and 404 pages

Product Photos - Essential for e-commerce and product listings

Team Photos - Perfect for about pages and company introductions

Device Mockups - Showcase your designs in realistic device frames

2. Smart Search

Default search for avatars when you open the plugin

Custom search input for specific queries

Easy-to-use radio button filters

Pagination for browsing through results

3. Image Management

Grid view of search results

Detailed view for each image

Download images directly

One-click insertion into Figma

View image details including dimensions and photographer credits

4. User-Friendly Interface

Modern dark theme design

Responsive grid layout

Loading indicators

Smooth transitions

Easy navigation

How to Use

Install the Plugin

Search for "Unsplash Image Search" in Figma's plugin menu

Click "Install"

Search for Images

Use the quick category buttons for common image types

Or type your search query in the search box

Click the search button or press Enter

Insert Images

Click on any image to view details

Click "Insert into Figma" to add to your design

Or click "Download" to save the image

Navigate Results

Use the pagination controls at the bottom

Click page numbers to jump to specific pages

Use previous/next buttons for sequential navigation

Tips

Start with the category buttons for quick access to common image types

Use specific search terms for more precise results

Check image dimensions before inserting

Use the refresh button to get new random images

Images are automatically tracked for proper attribution

Support

If you enjoy using this plugin, consider supporting its development by clicking the "Buy me coffee" button in the interface.
135190.tagline: Bring Unsplash to Figma Instantly search, preview, and insert stunning images with just a few clicks

plugins.name: Content Master
plugins.description:
Design more efficiently with data by searching for text content in your selection and generating real data into your text layers easily. Content master lets you find all instances of a text and replace them with data.


Features:


Find text content in the selection

Content Master will search through your selection and find all unique pieces of text content. It will then display these in a searchable list, allowing you to select and replace multiple items at once.


Replace content with data

Replace the selected text layers with real data like name, email address, physical address, company name, date, and lorem ipsum.


Create custom content with variables

Use static strings and dynamic data variables to create the content you need.


How to use

  1. Select layers in Figma
  2. Launch Content master
  3. Select text content in the searchable list
  4. Use quick replace cards or type text with variables in the Custom text field
  5. Optionally change variables settings below the variables buttons
  6. Hit Replace


To refresh the searchable list just select layers in Figma and hit Reload.
plugins.tagline: Design with data by searching for text and generating real data into your text layers easily.

plugins.name: Style Guide Generator - Pixelyo
plugins.description:
Style Guide Generator is designed to simplify the creation of a comprehensive style guide for design projects in Figma. It allows you to generate a complete style guide that includes typography, color schemes, and effects in a structured and easy-to-use manner.


Key Features of the Plugin:


Design Type Selection:

You can select the type of design you are working on, either for web or mobile applications. This allows you to customize options based on project requirements.


Font Selection:

Includes a list of ready-made fonts for selection, with an additional option for manually entering a custom font if the desired one is not available.


Primary and Accent Colors:

Defines the main colors, such as brand colors, accent colors, neutral colors, and specific colors for error, warning, and success states.

Users can easily view and edit these colors through a user-friendly interface with both a color picker and a manual hex input.


Point System Control:

Choose a point system (e.g., 4-Point Grid) to set the sizing system, helping in organizing and structuring the user interface more efficiently.


Customization Based on Design Type:

If the design is for a web project & Mobile, additional options like base font size and font scale ratio are available. These options help in setting consistent typography across the interface.

Interactive Style Guide Generation:


Once the desired properties are selected, you can press the "Generate Style Guide" button to create the style guide instantly.


Intended Use:

This plugin is particularly useful for designers who want to create a consistent style guide quickly and easily. It helps you compile all design properties, such as text styles, colors, and layout configurations in one place, making it easier to document your work and maintain consistency across the project.


If you need any adjustments or further details, feel free to let me know!
plugins.tagline: create style guide in seconds

- Added automatic style mapping for typography scales

- Added shadow colors to local variables
- Improved color scale generation
- Enhanced dark mode color adaptation
- Added color opacity variables
- Implemented semantic color naming system

- Improved spacing variables structure
- Added responsive spacing scales
- Enhanced spacing validation system
- Implemented consistent spacing tokens

- Added shadow color variables
- Improved shadow elevation scales
- Enhanced shadow color adaptation for themes
- Added semantic shadow naming system

- Improved color variable organization
- Enhanced spacing variable structure
- Added better variable naming conventions
- Implemented variable validation system
- Added variable documentation support

## General Improvements
- Enhanced error handling
- Improved performance for large design systems
- Added better type safety
- Enhanced documentation

plugins.name: Frames to Groups
plugins.description:
A Free plugin that turns any Frame into a Group without breaking visuals ‚Äî background, corner radius, nesting ‚Äî all preserved.


Perfect for clean exports, Lottie prep, and design cleanup.


How To Use

Select layers ‚Üí Run ‚ÄúConvert Frames to Groups‚Äù.


All Frames within your selection will be converted to Groups. If no layers are selected, all frames on the current page will be converted.


Features

  1. Works recursively inside nested Frames
  2. Preserves frame background colors and corner radii
  3. Compatible with Lottie animations export
  4. Includes Settings for fine-tuning behavior


Usage Notes

  1. To convert Frames inside an Instance, select the source Component
  2. Additional options available in Settings


Demo

See it in action:

View demo (gif)


Support

This plugin has forever free trial! If you find it useful and it saves you time, consider:


- Leaving a positive review

- Sharing it with your design team

- Support the creator by paying for the plugin

plugins.name: Slideshow
plugins.description:
You probably don't need this plugin!

As of June 2024, Figma itself offers the ability to create simple interactive prototypes with a couple clicks.


But if you're still interested‚Ä¶

This plugin automatically turns a series of frames into a prototype with Click action connections which take the viewer from frame to frame. The flow that results will follow the visual ordering of your frames on the canvas, according to the flow direction you choose.


Things to Know

Slideshow is intended to provide a starting point for further customization. If you have prototype connections already created, these will be discarded.


Note that Slideshow will run even if you haven't selected the Prototype panel, but the connections it creates will not be visible until you switch to Prototype view.
plugins.tagline: Turn your frames into a click-through slideshow.
